DataElement.preferredName: QuickDASH Outcome Measure Most Important Sport Or Musical Instrument Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text field to describe a person's most important sport or musical instrument.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: QuickDASH Outcome Measure Most Important Sport Or Musical Instrument
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An 11-item questionnaire designed to measure physical function and symptoms in people with any or multiple musculoskeletal disorders of the upper limb._Greatest in amount, extent, or degree; constituting a majority._Of great significance, value, or consequence._An active diversion requiring physical exertion and competition._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A device used to make musical tones or sounds.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An 11-item questionnaire designed to measure physical function and symptoms in people with any or multiple musculoskeletal disorders of the upper limb.

Concepts.definition: An 11-item questionnaire designed to measure physical function and symptoms in people with any or multiple musculoskeletal disorders of the upper limb.

Property.preferredName: Most Important Sport Or Musical Instrument
Property.preferredDefinition: Greatest in amount, extent, or degree; constituting a majority.:Of great significance, value, or consequence.:An active diversion requiring physical exertion and competition.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A device used to make musical tones or sounds.

Concepts.definition: Greatest in amount, extent, or degree; constituting a majority.
Of great significance, value, or consequence.
An active diversion requiring physical exertion and competition.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A device used to make musical tones or sounds.
